page.title: 17Landscape-Bolton by Bowland
page.content: Two becks run through the village,the {Kirk and Skirden}becks.Both of these join the{River Ribble. There is a waterfall in Holden called 'Scarloons'which is on the Holden Beck. There is a large area of land in the village called{Bolton Park.}The land used to belong to Bolton Hall(which was demolished),but is now mostly farmland.The park still has many deciduous trees and flowering shrubs. There is a row of 13 trees on the village green.The trees were planted in 1884,and are all Horse-chestnut and Lime trees,except for one,which is Oak. There are several mixed woods and conifer plantations in the eastern part of the area.
